title: So, Aurelion Sol's lore makes me fear what the new Pantheon, our Pantheon, may be like.
body:
As the title says. I truly hope our Pantheon, isn't going to be a shell like the one mentioned. I really hope that the personality of Atreus, the one we read about, connected to, will be present.

  But, damn, I loved Aurelion Sol's lore. that was amazing. I hope things go in his favor.

replies.body:
The aspect itself probably has its own personality,though I kinda doubt that Atreus won't come back.
Sure it was said that Atreus is gone now,but it would seem weird to establish him as a character only to replace him with someone different at the end.

I think a rioter even teased that Atreus might not be completely gone(saying that atreus being gone is the rule,but that rules are meant to be broken),but I dunno if it was someone from the lore team or not.
Rules were meant to be broken after all.
{{champion:86}} Wrong! Those who break rules are villains, and must face Justice!
But what if the rules themselves are unjust Garen?  What if the rulemakers misuse the rules to their own ends?

That is very simple. Are the rules in the King's name, and for the glory of Demacia? If yes, than they are just. If not, than they must be purged by the holy light of DEMACIA!
http://i.imgur.com/W0wVY4c.gif?Noredirect

You know, I can just imagine that Jarvan and Garen will probably have to duke it out at some point over what's best for Demacia. 

We need to go back to Demacia soon.
Wrong. Attacking Jarvan would be regicide, thus unjust. Anyone who attacks J4 will be purged from this earth by Garen.
But what if Jarvan attacked his father, the king?
That would be unjust, and thus Jarvan would never do it. Jarvan is just af.
Atreus is the number one knucklehead spartan

Maybe Atreus's lingering presence may make this incarnation of Pantheon stand out from the others? 



...It could play a part in him relenting the leash on Sol.

> Sure it was said that Atreus is gone now,but it would seem weird to establish him as a character only to replace him with someone different at the end.

> I think a rioter even teased that Atreus might not be completely gone(saying that atreus being gone is the rule,but that rules are meant to be broken),but I dunno if it was someone from the lore team or not.

It would be powerful to develop this character, take you through Atreus' story, and then completely take him over by an uncaring aspect. It would make you see that this is what they do to people unless its like Diana and Leona, which seems a bit rare.

> [{quoted}](name=MasqureMan,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=sEJ5MHM7,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2016-03-11T06:00:15.812+0000)
>
> It would be powerful to develop this character, take you through Atreus' story, and then completely take him over by an uncaring aspect. It would make you see that this is what they do to people unless its like Diana and Leona, which seems a bit rare.

Unfortunately doing that just made me despise my favorite champion.  But, to each their own, I suppose.

We already have the most dangerous thing confirmed...Pantheon is a weapon hipster, refusing to upgrade up from "Spear technology" for centurys, we have to force zombie attacks for him to even use something not QUITE a spear.

Here's a piano cover of the Aurelion Sol theme music:
www.youtube.com/watch?v=xWUrW2Xh-wg
Hope you find this interesting :)

In Pantheon's new lore his personality was erased by the aspect that took his body, Unlike what happened to Leona and Diana. It is likely that Leona and Diana will team up with Aurelion Sol to help him become free and to stop the invasion of the Void, while Pantheon tries to stop Aurelion.
